com.ftpos.library.smartpos.emv

Class Emv

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ftpos.library.smartpos.emv.Emv

  • public class Emv
extends java.lang.Object
    Copyright (C), 2015-2020,FEITIAN Technologies Co., Ltd. All rights reserved. EMV financial transaction interface is used to process the EMV transaction.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte EMV_CVMFLAG_ENOFFLINE_PIN_SIGN
      Request to enter offline text PIN
      static byte EMV_CVMFLAG_OLPIN_SIGN
      Require online PIN
      static byte EMV_CVMFLAG_PLOFFLINE_PIN_SIGN
      Requires offline plaintext PIN

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

      • getPinMode

        public byte getPinMode()

      • setPinMode

        public void setPinMode(byte pinMode)

      • getTransCardtype

        public int getTransCardtype()

      • startEMV

        public void startEMV(Amount amount,
                     TransRequest transRequest,
                     OnEmvResponse onEmvResponse)
        Start an EMV transaction processing process. After the transaction is started, the process will be processed automatically. All interactions with the App will be processed through the callback interface.
        Parameters:
        amount - Transaction amount object
        transRequest - Transaction request, including transaction type, transaction currency code, and other transaction-related data (transaction currency code has not been added yet)
        onEmvResponse - interface in the transaction processing process, the application needs to participate in processing related transactions.

      • stopEMV

        public void stopEMV()
        Stop the EMV transaction.

      • respondEvent

        public int respondEvent(java.lang.String tlvList)
        Responds to an EMV request event and wakes up the EMV process to continue the transaction.
        Parameters:
        tlvList - Parameters to be set to EMV Kernel. The data consists of a set of TLV data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • setTLV

        public int setTLV(java.lang.String tag,
                  java.lang.String value)
        This method is used to set the terminal or issuer data elements to the EMV Kernel.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag of a TLV object. Refer to EmvTags;
        value - The value of a TLV object.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • getTlvList

        public java.lang.String getTlvList(java.lang.String tagList)
        At each stage of transaction processing, the App may need to obtain some data elements from the Kernel. This method is used to meet this requirement.
        Parameters:
        tagList - A set of Tag, it can contain one or more TAG data.
        Returns:
        A set of TLV objects returned by Kernel.

      • getTLV

        public void getTLV(java.lang.String tag,
                   byte[] outData,
                   int[] outDataLen)
        At each stage of transaction processing, the App may need to obtain some data elements from the Kernel. This method is used to meet this requirement.
        Parameters:
        tag - A set of Tag, it can contain one or more TAG data.
        outData - A set of TLV objects returned by Kernel.
        outDataLen - Total length of TLV objects

      • getTLV

        public void getTLV(int tag,
                   byte[] outData,
                   int[] outDataLen)
        At each stage of transaction processing, the App may need to obtain some data elements from the Kernel. This method is used to meet this requirement.
        Parameters:
        tag - A Tag,the app needs to obtain.
        outData - The kernel returns the value Corresponds to the tag.
        outDataLen - The effective length of the returned data.

      • setDefaultAppParameters

        public int setDefaultAppParameters(byte[] tlvSet)
        Set default parameters for EMV transactions.
        Parameters:
        tlvSet - Containing default parameters for EMV transactions, which consists of a set of TLV data.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • setICS

        public int setICS(ICSparameter icsParameter)
        This method is used to set ICS for EMV transaction.
        Parameters:
        icsParameter - An object which contains ICS options for EMV contact and contactless transactions.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • manageEmvAppParameters

        public int manageEmvAppParameters(int action,
                                  byte[] tlvSet)
        This method is used to manage application parameters of EMV contact card transaction.
        Parameters:
        action - Action flag. Refer toIActionFlag.
        tlvSet - When action=0, tlvSet is a set of EMV contact application parameters that need to be added to the Kernel. When action=1, tlvSet should contain two TLV objects whose tags are "9F06" and "9C" respectively. Kernel will take these two TLV objects as indices and delete the matched application parameters. When Action=2, clears all application parameters for EMV contact transactions, the tlvSet should be set to null.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • manageEmvclAppParameters

        public int manageEmvclAppParameters(int action,
                                    byte[] tlvSet)
        This method is used to manage application parameters of EMV contactless card transaction.
        Parameters:
        action - Action flag. Refer toIActionFlag.
        tlvSet - When action=0, tlvSet is a set of EMV contactless application parameters that need to be added to the Kernel. When action=1, tlvSet should contain three TLV objects whose tags are "9F06", "1F60" and "9C" respectively. Kernel will take these three TLV objects as indices and delete the matched application parameters. When Action=2, clears all application parameters for EMV contactless transactions, the tlvSet should be set to null.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • manageDRL

        public int manageDRL(int action,
                     byte[] tlvSet)
        This method is used to manage DRL parameters of EMV contactless card transaction.
        Parameters:
        action - Action flag, refer toIActionFlag.
        tlvSet - When action=0, tlvSet is a set of DRL parameters that need to be added to the Kernel. When action=1, tlvSet should contain a TLV objects whose tags is "1F61". Kernel will take this TLV object as index and delete the matched DRL parameters. When action=2, clears all DRL parameters for EMV contactless transactions, the tlvSet should be set to null.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • managePRmacq

        public int managePRmacq(int action,
                        byte[] tlvSet)
        This method is used to manage PRmacq parameters of rupay transaction.
        Parameters:
        action - Action flag, refer toIActionFlag.
        tlvSet - When action=0, tlvSet is a set of PRmacq parameters that need to be added to the Kernel. When action=1, tlvSet should contain a TLV objects whose tags is "DF16". Kernel will take this TLV object as index and delete the matched PRmacq parameters. When action=2, clears all PRmacq parameters for EMV contactless transactions, the tlvSet should be set to null.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • manageCAPubKey

        public int manageCAPubKey(int action,
                          CAPublicKeyInfo pubKey)
        This method is used to set CA public key parameters to Kernel.
        Parameters:
        action - Action flag, Refer toIActionFlag.
        pubKey - The public key of CA, refer toCAPublicKeyInfo.
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • initPinEntry

        public java.lang.String initPinEntry()
        This method should first be called for initialization before an offline or online PIN is verified.This function generates a set of "0 to 9" random Numbers to initialize the layout of the random keyboard.
        Returns:
        A sequence of numbers ranging from '0' to '9'.

      • searchCard

        public void searchCard(int timeout,
                       OnSearchCardCallback onSearchCardCallback)
        Enable offline PIN input and send PIN verification instructions to the card.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum waiting time.
        onSearchCardCallback - A callback interface that receives card event.

      • switchDebug

        public int switchDebug(int flag)
        Enable kernel to enable log function.
        Parameters:
        flag - 0 - Disable the logging function 1 - Enable the adb logging function. 2 - Enable saving logs to file. 3 - Enable adb logging and saving logs to files at the same time.
        Returns:
        Refer toErrCode

      • StartPinInput

        public void StartPinInput(PinSeting pinSetting,
                          OnPinInputListener pinInputListener)
        Start typing password.
        Parameters:
        pinSetting - Password keyboard display parameter object.
        pinInputListener - Input PIN operation response interface.

      • StartPinInput

        public void StartPinInput(PinSeting pinSetting,
                          OnPinInputListener pinInputListener,
                          GetRegionCallBack getRegionCallBack)
        Start typing password.
        Parameters:
        pinSetting - Password keyboard display parameter object.
        pinInputListener - Input PIN operation response interface.
        getRegionCallBack - Gets the callback function of Pins Region

      • setIssuerOnlineResponseData

        public int setIssuerOnlineResponseData(int onlineResult,
                                       java.lang.String AuthenticationCode,
                                       java.lang.String AuthenticationResponseCode,
                                       java.lang.String issuerAuthenticationData,
                                       java.lang.String issuerScript71,
                                       java.lang.String issuerScript72)
        After online processing with the issuing bank, the issuing bank provides online related data, and the user sets the data to the kernel through this method.
        Parameters:
        onlineResult - values for the Online results:0:success,1:failure.
        AuthenticationCode - Authorisation Identification Response.
        AuthenticationResponseCode - Code that defines the disposition of a message.
        issuerAuthenticationData - Data sent to the ICC for online issuer authentication
        issuerScript71 - Issuing bank script 1
        issuerScript72 - Issuing bank script 2
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • setCRL

        public int setCRL(int action,
                  byte[] tlvSet)
        Set the certificate revocation list (set once when the global data app starts, not every transaction)
        Parameters:
        action - Action flag. Refer toIActionFlag.
        tlvSet - TLV data for revocation of certificate
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • setExceptionList

        public int setExceptionList(int action,
                            byte[] tlvSet)
        Set the blacklist (set once when the global data app is started, not every transaction)
        Parameters:
        action - Action flag. Refer toIActionFlag.
        tlvSet - Blacklist TLV data
        Returns:
        0: Success; Other values: Error code. Refer toErrCode

      • getDefaultIFDSerial

        public java.lang.String getDefaultIFDSerial()
        Obtain a unique IFD number, parsed according to SN
        Returns:
        IFD number

      • getCardData

        public java.lang.String getCardData(java.lang.String tagList)
        Get card data through getDataAPDU command.This method is only suitable for use in transactions.
        Parameters:
        tagList - Pass in the list of TAGs that need to be obtained.E.g:"9F179F369F139F4F".
        Returns:
        Successfully returned to the TLV list; fail:null
